Author: Mark-SmartCash#4571
Content: Is this possible with a deadline?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, i will pay you from my personal funds if needed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but you will need to provide the (expired) privkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it will be much easier if you can just do the conversion yourself

Author: Mark-SmartCash#4571
Content: Of course, I would prefer to do it myself as well.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://www.dexstats.info/explorers.php shows the amount of sprout funds left

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: hopefully everyone who has funds in sprout zcaddrs can convert to taddr or sapling by the deadline and we can get to less than 0.01% that needs to be redeemed the hard way (and costing me personally)

Author: Mark-SmartCash#4571
Content: Sure. I'm curious why this is the desired route technically, and what sort of advantage this is over just allowing using the old addresses ongoing, at an upgrade at any point in time. What are benefits to this approach of a deadline?

Author: Mark-SmartCash#4571
Content: Guaranteeing funds are absolutely not your responsibility.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well it was my decision to technically deprecate the sprout, so I will take the financial responsibility

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in my technical judgement, having literally half the zksnark code duplicated to provide backward compatiblity for a 100x slower tech, well, it just feels so wrong

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we are talking about the same amount of overall code, used by 0.1% of coin supply, that is 50x to 100x slower

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: There seems to be some confusion about who needs to convert funds. 99.9% of people (KMD) wont have to do anything at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is only the 0.1% who took the time to create and fund sprout zaddr that need to convert

Author: Mark-SmartCash#4571
Content: I think it's more the idea of not being able to use your coins in the future that is more unsettling, regardless of it affecting a minority.

Author: Mark-SmartCash#4571
Content: That seems to violate a core tenant of what many believe is useful and valuable in cryptocurrency.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we are talking about doubling the code to maintain legacy support of the same functionality that is 50x slower and uses more 50x more RAM

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now if your funds are in the normal agama 'R' address, then this does not affect you at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I guess if we werent in such a deep bear market and we had more funds available, we could hire dedicated devs to maintain the old codebase... But we have not been getting any donations for doing this. Do you think there will be much donations for the "keep the sprout alive" effort?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if there is an overwhelming support to keep the sprout alive, with the required donations, then I am open to change my decision

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Mark-SmartCash how much will you donate for the cause?

Author: Mark-SmartCash#4571
Content: I will donate the balance of my z addresses, on the condition I can keep them. üòÑ

Author: Mark-SmartCash#4571
Content: I've got to take dog for a walk, thanks for sharing the viewpoints!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe one way to look at it is that this bear market is causing some projects to scale way down, or even shutdown. For KMD, it caused us to deprecate sprout support

Author: Paul#0981
Content: Will komodo soon go on the offensive in marketing?  So that finally everyone knows what Kmd can do to send eth into retirement?

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: My thoughts....

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: @jl777c   I don't think economic climate should be part of an immutability discussion, no special team has been required to maintain z-addresses up until this point.     On the other hand, I don't agree with @Mark-SmartCash  either  üòÉ       This is because I am difficult.

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: @Mark-SmartCash ,  I would point you to:

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content:
```Build Komodo

This software is based on zcash and considered experimental and is continously undergoing heavy development.```

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: https://github.com/jl777/komodo

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: This project is bleeding edge.  Immutability is a goal, not a promise, imho.    If you've invested in that goal, then you share our dream, but we are on a journey here.    If we're going to improve the performance of the blockchain by 50x and make its size vastly more sustainable, remember that this is experimental, and help us out

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: I would propose that @jl777c 's decision is the right one, and we should support it.   But if there is a way to turn  2 months into 6 months, that would be cool too.

Author: bishop#9773
Content: I fail to see how two months to make appropriate conversions is that big of an issue for those that are still utilizing sprout zaddrs

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Even the most complicated cold storage setup can be planned for in that amount of time

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: @bishop  2 months might be ok, but I don't think that is a decision you base on Nano-ledger operation.    To answer that question imho one must go back to why the Z-addresses were created in the first place.    Say you are in a country or state where you are persecuted against.    Internet access is restricted/monitored.     Crypto forbidden.   You've chosen to store wealth in Z-addresses for these reasons.    Now the question is, what is a realistic time to transfer these funds, for you.      I can't answer that.       Overthought, maybe.  But therein would lie the arguement for an extension past 2 months.

Author: bishop#9773
Content: @smellycouch  Since when does the nano support zaddrs?

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Further in your restricted/monitored scenario, use a vpn

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Finally, if it's really THAT bad, two months is ample time to make travel arrangements

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: The scenario given would imply restricted or forbidden travel capabilities, unfortunately.  VPNs would typically be out of the question for said individuals and could cost them jail or their life.    Their ability to even find out about the Sapling update would be very limited.   All my wallets are hot, I wouldn't know about ledger, just pointing out that cold storage transfer would not be a decider for the time allowance.

Author: bishop#9773
Content: The I would question how they acquired crypto to begin with

Author: bishop#9773
Content: seems wayyy out there to extend a very reasonable timeframe for migration, but I've said my peace.

Author: haha#6652
Content: Why isn't KMD worth more than ZEC? Isn't KMD as private as ZEC but with more security?

Author: haha#6652
Content: No zec is not as secure as btc

Author: haha#6652
Content: 1. It doesn't have anywhere near BTC's hashrate. 2. Because their ledger is private you can't see if the network if being 51% attacked

Author: haha#6652
Content: Both of these are solved by KMD since you need to 51% attack btc to 51% attack KMD and you can see attacks taking place on bitcoin

Author: haha#6652
Content: You can't see ZEC being 51% attacked if you can't see stolen coins.

Author: haha#6652
Content: Miners just double spend a private ZEC transaction and boom, new coins and no one will know

Author: haha#6652
Content: Yes it does, it's how you create new coins

Author: haha#6652
Content: A double spend attack leaves the attacker with more coins than they started with

Author: haha#6652
Content: = more money

Author: haha#6652
Content: You just 51% attack till the exchange allows you to deposit

Author: haha#6652
Content: On ZEC the exchange will not realize it's  51% attack

Author: haha#6652
Content: If the total supply of a coin can't be proven and you 51% attack then send your money to exchanges

Author: haha#6652
Content: Actually when you stop 51% attacking, do the coins you double spended disappear? @Deleted User

Author: haha#6652
Content: what are you talking about?

Author: haha#6652
Content: Okay lets restart since i think I'm confused. If I 51% attack ZEC and send new ZECs to exchanges to sell

Author: haha#6652
Content: is there a way of telling ZEC was 51% attacked

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: When a 51 occurs the first transaction is invalidated no new coins are created

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: He just gets the coins he originally sent to the exchange back

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Because in his version of the chain  it didn't happen

Author: haha#6652
Content: So the exchange will be able to tell when their amount of ZEC differs from the amount deposited

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Yes and by then the hacker made off with the BTC

Author: haha#6652
Content: What if it's a dex?

Author: haha#6652
Content: I'm guessing the dex will just be killed off or something right?

Author: haha#6652
Content: Since there'd be no way for users to withdraw coins in that case

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Pretty much ,  not sure if it's been done because a ) dexs have low liquidityand b) typically on some form of PoS chain

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Eth dex has eth hash protecting it
